casebody.data:
CABARRUS COUNTY BOARD OF EDUCATION
v.
BOARD OF TRUSTEES TEACHERS' & STATE EMPLOYEES' RETIREMENT SYSTEM, et al. 371PA18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 7, 2019 Blake W. Thomas, Deputy General Counsel, Raleigh, for Board of Trustees Teachers and State Employees' Retirement System, et al. Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, Raleigh, for Board of Trustees Teachers and State Employees' Retirement System, et al. Michael Crowell, Attorney at Law, for Cabarrus County Board of Education. Deborah R. Stagner, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Cabarrus County Board of Education. Elizabeth L. Troutman, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, for N.C. School Boards Association. Allison B. Schafer, Legal Counsel/Director of Policy, for N.C. School Boards Association. Jill R. Wilson, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, for N.C. School Boards Association. Ryan Y. Park, Deputy Solicitor General, for Board of Trustees Teachers and State Employees' Retirement System, et al. Joseph A. Newsome, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Board of Trustees Teachers and State Employees' Retirement System, et al. Lindsey V. Smith, Attorney at Law, for Cabarrus County Board of Education.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 7th of August 2019 by North Carolina School Board Association for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 7th of August 2019."
